title_sort: walt whitman to william d. o'connor, 29 september 1884
title: Walt Whitman to William D. O'Connor, 29 September 1884
text: W. W. | Answ'd Oct 3/84.328 Mickle streetCamden New JerseySeptember 29 '84Dear friendEnclosed a little piece the whole idea of which I got from you—as you see. It is in the Critic of Sept. 27—Dry and warm and often oppressive weather here—a long spell—My lameness seems permanent like—I have promised to write a War Hospital Article for Century to supplement their forthcoming swell [of] war narratives by Grant & the rest.William, I wonder if you or Charles Eldridge couldn't help me to something there from the Medical Bureau—summaries, or statistics or any information—who do you know in the Surgeon Gen[eral]'s office?Walt Whitman Walt Whitman to William D. O'Connor, 29 September 1884
